sentences.sContent: Teacher: "John, what is the past participle of the verb to ring?"
sentences.sContent_eng: Teacher: "John, what is the past participle of the verb to ring?"
sentences.sCn: 老师：“John，动词ring的过去分词是什么？”

sentences.sContent: Some, like swonken (the past participle of swink, meaning “to toil”, but also used to mean coupling), have disappeared.
sentences.sContent_eng: Some, like swonken (the past participle of swink, meaning “to toil”, but also used to mean coupling), have disappeared.
sentences.sCn: 如swonken（swink之过去分词，意指”辛苦劳作，艰难进行“，但亦有”交媾“之意。） ，但swonken一词早已消失。

sentences.sContent: So there will be a participle necessary.
sentences.sContent_eng: So there will be a participle necessary.
sentences.sCn: 于是就有了分词的必要。

trans.tranOther: one of the forms of a verb that are used to make tenses. In English,  present participle s  end in -ing and  past participle s  usually end in -ed or -en.
